descript.abstract: This shapefile is the administrative boundaries for the Philadelphia Police Department's districts. Districts are subdivided into sectors. A police Captain is responsible for each district. Several districts are aggregated into divisions.
descript.purpose: The district layer was developed for cartographic production, reporting, re-deployment and analysis purposes within the PPD.

idinfo.accconst: City of Philadelphia employees only and those granted permission or access.

cntperp.cntorg: Philadelphia Police Department - Crime Analysis and Mapping unit

idinfo.datacred: James Cardona Robert Cheetham Kevin Switala
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3000

attracc.attraccr: The attributes were checked by individual districts for accuracy.

citeinfo.origin: Philadelphia Police Department Crime Analysis and Mapping Unit
citeinfo.title: POLICE: Police Sectors
STREETS: Curb Edges, Other Transportation Features

srcinfo.srccitea: STREETS: Curb Edges, Other Transportation Features

procstep.procdesc: The Crime Analysis and Mapping group requested and received paper-based descriptions of the district and sector outlines. These included paper maps and text descriptions of the bounding streets of each sector. Based on the District coverage digitized and snapped to the street centerline by Jim Querry in summer 1997, the districts were subdivided into Sectors using ArcView 3.0a. Due to the limitations of ArcView, these sector boudaries were not snapped to the Street Centerline. In the process, several discrepancies were discovered in the earlier work by MOIS, mostly in the areas bordering the parks and a missing district at the airport.
procstep.srcused: STREETS: Curb Edges, Other Transportation Features

cntperp.cntorg: Philadelphia Police Department - Crime Analysis and Mapping unit

procstep.procdesc: Districts 90 and 92 (Fairmount Park) were combined into a single district 92. Since reattribution was required, the opportunity was taken to verify the original park sector boundaries done the previous year. The same boundaries were used, but District 90's sectors were re-labeled G,H,I,J,K.

cntperp.cntorg: Philadelphia Police Department - Crime Analysis and Mapping unit

procstep.procdesc: Police Department is in the process of re-sectoring all districts - changes will be frequent through 2001. As changes where made, the sector boundaries and/or attributes would be unioned to create a new district layer.

cntperp.cntorg: Philadelphia Police Department - Crime Analysis and Mapping unit

procstep.procdesc: District boundary changes between the 6th/9th and the 3rd/17th took place December 15th, which necessitated a change in the sector layer. To maintain vertex integrity between the districts and sectors, a non-dircect method was used using ArcView3.1. The district layer was changed prior to the sector change and was utilized to maintain integrity during the entire process.

cntperp.cntorg: Philadelphia Police Department - Crime Analysis and Mapping Unit

procstep.procdesc: District boundary changes between the 16th and 19th took place December 15th, which necessitated a change in the district layer polygons. A process of subtracting and unioning sector polygons to and from the existing districts sustained vertex integrity throughout this process.

cntperp.cntorg: Philadelphia Police Department - Crime Analysis and Mapping Unit

procstep.procdesc: Brian Ivey (MOIS) returned an ArcInfo export file of our sectors with the boundaries snapped to the street centerlines. He used a series of commands in ArcEdit to re-construct the boundaries using the composite layer (which includes rail, hydro, street centerlines, and the citywide boundary).

cntperp.cntorg: Philadelphia Police Department - Crime Analysis and Mapping unit

procstep.procdesc:
A slight change was made between the 6th and the 9th district. Along Broad Street, City Hall now falls in the 6th as opposed to the 9th.
1. A polygon from the sector layer edited previously (sector G of the 9th district) was pasted into the district layer. It was then used in a subtraction process from the 9th, and a union process with the 6th district polygon.

cntperp.cntorg: Philadelphia Police Department - Crime Analysis and Mapping Unit

procstep.procdesc:
There has been a little known error in the PPD's district, division, and sector shapefile. The Benjamin Franklin Parkway (from SW to NE curblines) is actually within the Park Division and not the 9th district. While this makes for an awkward boundary, it was decided to alter it using the street curblines layer as opposed to the centerline.
The polygons were edited in ArcInfo 7.1 using the following commands: shapearc, clean, regionpoly, createlabel, idedit, put, extend, clean, and arcshape.

cntperp.cntorg: Philadelphia Police Department - Crime Analysis and Mapping Unit

cntaddr.address: Police Headquarters, Rm 211 One Franklin Square

procstep.procdesc:
There was a three way trade-off of sectors between the 14th, 35th, and 39th district. The process was completed using the subtract and union commands contained in the Geo-processing Wizard extension of ArcView3.2
The district/sector changes are outlined in the table below:
35L to 14A 35N to 14B 35O to 14C 35P to 14Q
14A to 39S 14B to 39T 14C to 39U 14Q to 39V 14Y to 39W
Other attributes of the sector polygons, such as car number, were also changed

cntperp.cntorg: Philadelphia Police Department - Crime Analysis and Mapping Unit

cntaddr.address: Police Headquarters, Rm 211 One Franklin Square

procstep.procdesc: Revised sector coverage was dissolved using dist_num field. Dissolve used the Net option to preserve arc attributes. Attributes were brought in from old District coverage using JoinItem command with the Dist_Num field as the relate item.

cntperp.cntorg: Philadelphia Police Department - Crime Analysis and Mapping Unit

cntaddr.address: Police Headquarters, Rm 211 One Franklin Square

cntperp.cntorg: Philadelphia Police Department - Crime Analysis and Mapping unit

procstep.procdesc: Performed edits on this layer since the 92nd District (Fairmount Park) went away. The surrounding districts have been changed to take on the parts of Fairmount Park that the 92nd District took on.

altsys.altenc: Explicit elevation coordinate included with horizontal coordinates

attr.attrdefs: Use this field for polygon identification

attr.attrdef: Division that the DIST_NUMC falls in
Area of feature in internal units squared.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

distinfo.distliab: This dataset contains errors that are an artifact of the interpretation, source material and conversion process. The data and documentation are provided "as is." The City of Philadelphia (CITY) makes no warranty or representation, either express or implied, with respect to the data or accompanying documentation, including its quality, performance or accuracy. The CITY will not be liable for any direct, indirect, special, incidental, or consequential damages arising out of the use or inability to use the data or any accompanying documentation. The CITY is working to correct errors found in its datasets. Users discovering errors or making corrections to the data are requested to report such errors to the POLICE DEPARTMENT at 215-686-1577.

stdorder.ordering: Please contact the Deputy Commissioner of Science and Technology at 215-686-1227 or the Crime Analysis and Mapping Unit at 215-686-1577.

distinfo.custom: Any request for data should be channeled through the Deputy Commissioner of Science and Technology (215-686-1227). The City of Philadelphia does not currently have a commercial distribution policy.
